spatial_accuracy.notes: Overall topology resembles the 2BHK (2 beds + living/dining + kitchen + 2 toilets + 2 decks + utility), but several spatial mismatches exist. The foyer zone shown on the plan (separate small entry pocket) is not clearly formed in the 3D; entry appears to open more directly into the living/dining (E1/E2). Kitchen/utility compartmentalization differs: the utility enclosure/door relationship to the kitchen is unclear/shifted (E2/E3). Bathroom placements appear offset: the Toilet-1 near the top-center (between living and Bed-1) does not match the plan’s tight position and access pattern as rendered (E2). Room proportions are not preserved: living/dining reads more compact/square than the plan’s elongated 15' x 21'4"; decks/baths also read proportionally different (E4).

structural_fidelity.notes: Wall network is broadly similar but fidelity is inconsistent. Several internal partitions (notably around the foyer/kitchen/utility junction) do not match the plan’s wall breaks and door-defined separations (E2). Adjacency is partially correct (beds flank living; toilets near living/kitchen), but the exact adjacency/access of Toilet-1 and the foyer-to-living transition appear altered (E2/E3). At least one element in the living area resembles an extra partition/column-like mass not indicated in the 2D plan (possible hallucinated partition) (E5). No completely new major rooms are added, but the plan-defined foyer as a distinct space is effectively missing (E1).

furniture_mapping.notes: Major furniture types are mapped plausibly (beds in each bedroom; sofa/coffee table/rug in living; dining set near center; kitchen counters present). However, some placements/scales deviate from the plan: dining and living grouping encroach/shift relative to the plan’s clear central zoning; built-ins/wardrobe runs and bath fixtures do not consistently reflect the 2D arrangement (E2/E4).

aesthetic_quality.notes: Render is visually clean with coherent materials and readable room separation. Camera is isometric-like but includes noticeable perspective (not true orthographic) (E6). Lighting is acceptable but slightly flat; geometry is mostly clean with minor thickness/edge inconsistencies. Overall composition is clear, though some walls/doors read ambiguously due to angle and occlusion.

detected_errors.description: Foyer space shown in the 2D plan (distinct small entry pocket) is not clearly present/defined in the 3D; entry appears to open directly into living/dining.
Kitchen–utility relationship differs from plan: utility enclosure/partitioning and its connection to the kitchen appear shifted/unclear compared to the 2D layout.
Toilet-1 location/access (top-center between living and Bed-1 in the plan) appears repositioned/offset in the 3D, altering the intended circulation.

Several door placements/orientations are inconsistent with the plan-defined separations (notably around the kitchen/utility and foyer/living transitions), reducing correspondence of intended thresholds.
Room proportion distortion: living/dining appears less elongated than the plan’s 15' x 21'4"; decks/bath volumes also read differently in size ratio.
Possible hallucinated internal mass/partition in the living zone (column-like/standalone wall element) not indicated on the 2D plan.
View is not strictly orthographic/isometric; perspective and occlusion make door/window verification ambiguous and reduce projection fidelity.
